intro: Jenkinsonia canariensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in racemes. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in southern Europe and the United States.
